jobDescription: The Fuel System Specialist tests, adjusts and repairs a variety of airframe fuel systems and their related components on a variety of airframes in a safe and clean work environment according to manufacturer's specifications, Duncan Aviation approved procedures and customer specifications. In addition, this position assists with troubleshooting fuel systems and their related components; prepares and completes appropriate documentation in a timely manner; and trains less experienced team members through the OJT process. Essential Job Functions 1. With limited supervision, uses proper application of sealants and fasteners and appropriate tooling to repair aircraft fuel systems according to manufacturer's requirements and Duncan Aviation approved procedures in a safe and clean work environment. Services and maintains aircraft fuel systems and components using proper hand tools in a timely, clean, safe and professional manner with limited or no rework.  2. Performs basic troubleshooting and repairs to fuel system wiring and components. Assists with removal of major components. Applies Service Bulletins (SBs) and Airworthiness Directives (ADs) as required.  3. Creates detailed maps of fuel system leaks and required repairs.  4. Prepares various documents for record keeping purposes, as required by Company policy and FAA regulations (i.e. turnovers, removal sheets, personal training log, etc.). Demonstrates proficiency of Duncan Aviation work order system, service plans, Tracker and outside maintenance tracking programs by completing accurate and timely discrepancies and corrective action statements, Service Bulletins and Airworthiness Directives (AD) Compliance statements, final inspection and closing of squawks and work orders.  5. Willingly and effectively shares knowledge and capabilities with less experienced technicians through OJT to foster their development, ensure accurate work and support the team's goals.  6. Consistently locates and uses appropriate technical data and follows verbal instructions when accomplishing assigned maintenance tasks.  7. Performs other related duties as assigned by management.
